title: Sympathetic Vibration & Resonance
author: Christopher Macachor
core_statement: Sympathetic vibration is the cause of another frequency vibration of higher amplitude resulting in resonance.

definitions.definition: The inherent frequency at which a system oscillates when disturbed and then left to vibrate freely.
The process by which a driver vibrating at a specific frequency induces oscillations in a resonator with a matching natural frequency.
The condition of maximum energy transfer and amplitude, achieved when the driving frequency matches the natural frequency of the resonator.

examples.name: Tuning Fork and Piano
examples.description: The piano string vibrates audibly in sympathy with the fork.

examples.name: Tacoma Narrows Bridge
examples.description: Wind-induced sympathetic vibration led to resonant oscillation and structural failure.
